content:
Why do some declarations in Mathlib have their last (positional) argument implicit?
What is the motivation?
Can be inferred from result type maybe? Can't say without examples

Yes, it is used only if it can be inferred from the result type.
This requirement is the same as for any other arguments.
But what is it good for when it is the last positional argument?
It's usually because it's an iff or a lemma that otherwise will be used for dot notation more than it will be used for rewriting
Oh yes. It makes sense now. It never occurred to me that it might be useful to make the last argument implicit, since I avoid .mp and .mpr religiously.
Martin Dvořák has marked this topic as resolved.
